content.title: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance
content.department: Chief Minister's Secretariat, Govt. of Rajasthan
content.beneficiary: Residents of Rajasthan affected by accidents
content.details: Launched in April 1999, 'Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance' provides ₹ 1,00,000 to the dependent of the deceased in case of death due to accident, and up to ₹ 20,000 for serious injuries. A revolving fund of ₹20,00,000 is available to all district collectors for assistance.
benefits: In case of death due to accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided to the dependent of the deceased.
In case of serious injury, assistance should be approved up to ₹ 20,000, keeping in view the seriousness of the injury.
A revolving fund of ₹20,00,000 each has been made available to all district collectors.
The assistance is 'one-time full-support' and is sanctioned by the concerned District Collector.
In case of death of a seriously injured person in an accident while undergoing treatment, assistance is given on applying within a period of 6 months from the date of death.
eligibility: The victim should be a resident of the state of Rajasthan.
The victim should have suffered serious injury / death.
In case of death, the assistance is payable only to the dependent parents/husband-wife/son-daughter of the deceased.
Under special circumstances, assistance can be given to grandparents/dependent siblings with the consent of the Chief Minister's Office.
In cases of murder and rape, action should be taken to give compensation under the Rajasthan Victim Compensation (Amended) Scheme-2015.
The applicant must apply within a maximum period of 6 months from the date of accident.
exclusions: Assistance is not payable twice in the same case.
Assistance is not payable in case of loss of property due to fire or other reasons.
Assistance is not payable in cases of suicide.
Assistance should not be given from the Chief Minister's Relief Fund in case assistance is due from other schemes of the state government.
It is not necessary to provide assistance if the family is capable.
content.application_process: Offline. The letter requesting the assistance, along with the required self-attested documents must be sent to the Official Email ID of CMRF: cmrf.cmo@rajasthan.gov.in, or in person, to the concerned Tehsil/District Collector's Office, or to the Chief Accounts Officer (CAO), Room No. 301, Chief Minister's Office, Government Secretariat, Jaipur, Rajasthan - 302 005.
documents_required: Proof of Identity of the Applicant (and of the deceased, if applicable)
Post Mortem Report in Case of Death (Mandatory) or In Case of Mutilation of the Dead Body, the Satisfaction Certificate of the Inquest Officer (Mandatory).
First Page of Bank Account Passbook / Canceled Check or Photocopy.

faqs.question: When Was The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund Launched?
faqs.answer: The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund was launched in April 1999.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided In Case Of 'Death Due To Accident'?
faqs.answer: In case of death due to an accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided to the dependent of the deceased.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided In Case Of 'Serious Injury'?
faqs.answer: In case of serious injury, assistance should be approved up to ₹ 20,000, keeping in view the seriousness of the injury.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Revolving Fund That Has Been Made Available To The District Collectors Of Rajasthan?
faqs.answer: A revolving fund of ₹20,00,000 each has been made available to all district collectors.

faqs.question: Is The Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided As A Lump Sum Or In Installments?
faqs.answer: The assistance is 'one-time full-support' and is provided as lumpsum.

faqs.question: Who Sanctions The Amount Of Financial Assistance?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance is sanctioned by the concerned District Collector.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines can be found at this link - https://jankalyan.rajasthan.gov.in/#/scheme/detail/435.

faqs.question: How Can One Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: To apply to this scheme, the letter requesting the assistance, along with the required self-attested documents must be sent to the Official Email ID of CMRF: cmrf.cmo@rajasthan.gov.in, or in person, to the concerned Tehsil/District Collector's Office, or to the Chief Accounts Officer (CAO), Room No. 301, Chief Minister's Office, Government Secretariat, Jaipur, Rajasthan - 302 005.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Required In Order To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The following documents are required in order to apply to this scheme: Application, Medical Report of the Injured (Mandatory), Post Mortem Report in Case of Death (Mandatory) or In Case of Mutilation of the Dead Body, the Satisfaction Certificate of the Inquest Officer (Mandatory), FIR Report (Mandatory), Ration Card, Aadhaar Card, First Page of Bank Account Passbook / Canceled Check or Photocopy, Income Certificate/Proof, Address Proof (Ration Card), Treatment Estimate by the Doctor.

faqs.question: What Is The Official Email ID Of The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund?
faqs.answer: The official Email ID of the Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund is: cmrf.cmo@rajasthan.gov.in.

faqs.question: In What Case Is A Satisfaction Certificate Of The Inquest Officer Mandatory?
faqs.answer: In case of mutilation of the dead body, the satisfaction certificate of the inquest officer is mandatory.

faqs.question: Is The FIR Report Mandatory In Order To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the FIR Report is a mandatory document.

faqs.question: What Is The Address Of The Chief Accounts Officer (CAO) Of Govt. Of Rajasthan?
faqs.answer: The address of the Chief Accounts Officer (CAO) is: Room No. 301, Chief Minister's Office, Government Secretariat, Jaipur, Rajasthan - 302 005.
